section.title: Enable browser bypass with the Content-Disposition header
section.para: When an object is assigned the Content-Disposition header you can override a browser's default behavior for a file so that the download program saves the file rather than displaying it using default browser settings.

example.title: Content-Disposition header request: HTTP
example.para: In the example, the content-encoding header is assigned with an attachment type that indicates how the file should be downloaded.
